properties.name: Powhatan Confederacy
properties.description: A powerful confederation of Algonquian-speaking peoples in what is now eastern Virginia at the time of the first English settlements.

properties.name: Haudenosaunee (Iroquois) Confederacy
properties.description: A confederacy of six nations (Mohawk, Onondaga, Oneida, Cayuga, Seneca, and Tuscarora) that dominated the northeastern region.

properties.name: Cherokee (ᏣᎳᎩ) Ancestral Lands
properties.description: The vast ancestral homelands of the Cherokee people before forced removal in the 1830s.

properties.name: Lakota Territory (Oceti Sakowin)
properties.description: The Great Sioux Nation territory as recognized in the Treaty of Fort Laramie of 1851.

properties.name: Navajo Nation (Diné Bikéyah)
properties.description: The modern-day boundaries of the Navajo Nation, the largest land area retained by a Native American tribe in the US.

properties.name: Great Sioux Reservation
properties.description: The reservation established by the Treaty of Fort Laramie in 1868 before it was broken up by the US government.

properties.name: Cherokee Nation (Modern)
properties.description: The jurisdictional area of the Cherokee Nation in Oklahoma today.
